intro: Commiphora ankaranensis, commonly known as the Ankaranensis myrrh tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Burseraceae. It is native to Madagascar and is characterized by its aromatic resinous sap, which has been traditionally used in local medicine. The plant typically grows as a small to medium-sized tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and have a leathery texture, while its flowers are small and inconspicuous. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological role and potential medicinal properties.
